head.title: 2 New York Prosecutors Nominated to Bench

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: 2 New York Prosecutors Nominated to Bench

block.p: Two prosecutors in New York City have been nominated for Federal judgeships, Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato announced yesterday.

Sterling Johnson Jr., the city's Special Narcotics Prosecutor for 16 years, has been nominated to the Eastern District. Louis J. Freeh, the third-ranking member of the United States Attorney's office in Manhattan and a former F.B.I. agent, was nominated to a vacancy in the Southern District, Mr. D'Amato said.
Mr. Freeh, 40, is now preparing to lead the prosecution of the Atlanta bombing case in which a Georgia man is accused of mailing bombs to a Federal judge and a civil rights attorney, killing both.
Mr. Johnson, 56, was a city police officer from 1956 to 1967 and a Federal prosecutor for three years after leaving the force.
Asked if he could fight drugs as effectively as a judge, Mr. Johnson said: "Power is not the name of the game. Now it's time to make another kind of contribution."
Two prosecutors in New York City have been nominated for Federal judgeships, Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato announced yesterday.
